snippet: Ford is recalling about 433,000 of its newest cars and sport utilities because drivers may not be able to shut off the engine, even after pressing the “stop engine” button.
abstract: Ford will recall roughly 433,000 cars and sport utility vehicles, saying in some cases drivers may be unable to shut off engines.
lead_paragraph: Ford is recalling about 433,000 of its newest cars and sport utilities because drivers may not be able to shut off the engine, even after pressing the “stop engine” button.

headline.main: A Ford Recall for Engines That Might Not Turn Off
headline.print_headline: A Ford Recall for Engines That Might Not Turn Off
